column4: Question then:  I have someone that's trying dictionary attacks against my Ubuntu box.  Is there a way I can configure SSH so that it not let someone continue to try and log into my box after a certain number of failures?
look into denyhosts
rycuda, WaxyFresh: I'll look does that just do a specific IP or a policy?
what version of ubuntu?
is that dapper?
I think so. It's the latest stable server version.
I installed it only about 2 weeks ago.
lsb_release -a
in a shell
Sorry, Copy and paste.  Yes, Dapper 6.06
Description:    Ubuntu 6.06.1 LTS
hmm denyhosts was only pacakged in edgy
Is there a Ubuntu list I can check for this? I've only see the packages.debian.org
well you should just use apt-cache search, but ubuntu has packages.ubuntu.com
okay. I tried the apt-cache and I don't see it.  I've added the universe and the multiverse
right, because denyhosts is not packaged in dapper.  Only edgy.  Grab denyhosts from the sourceforge page, it's a python script, so it should be relatively painless
Oh, okay. Can I not grab the package from the debian package site and install it with an installer? Just the manual install?
it may not work.  I know that the feisty and edgy packages for denyhosts are not compatible for example
Okay. I'll just grab the manual install and do it from SF.
Thank you very much for the help.
